original_title: Sri Lanka rupee opens at 328.50/90 to the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s rupee opened at 328.50/90 to the US dollar on Monday, from 328.60/80 Friday, dealers said.
On the Colombo Stock Exchange, the All Share Price Index opened up 0.06 percent, or 5.79 points, at 10,532.
The more liquid S&P SL20 was up 0.40 percent, or 11.99 points, at 2,993. Turnover was 24 million.
A bond maturing on 01.06.2025 was quoted stable at 13.80/14.10 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.08.2026 was quoted at 14.20/35 percent from 14.20/40 percent.
A bond maturing on 15.01.2027 was quoted at 14.30.40 percent from 14.35/45 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2028 was quoted stable at 14.55/65 percent. (Colombo/Nov27/2023)
